snippet: An attack on a Helmand Province police headquarters was part of the militants’ increased efforts to protect opium poppy farmers and their economic interests.
abstract: Taliban is so focused on securing Afghanistan's opium poppy crop, and the support of the farmers tending it, that in the early days of their spring offensive in the south, they are targeting not only the officials trying to eradicate the plants, but also the tractors they use to plow them up; poppy fields are sown with land mines, signaling increased cooperation between poppy farmers and the militants they see as protectors of their economic interests.

byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and ALISSA J. RUBIN

lead_paragraph: An attack on a Helmand Province police headquarters was part of the militants’ increased efforts to protect opium poppy farmers and their economic interests.
